Generated Assessment: She couldn't help but feel that she was being unfairly compared to those in higher positions, especially when they had years of experience under their belts. It wasn't just the junior colleague's comment; even the senior researchers seemed to look down upon her work, as if it didn't measure up to their standards. She felt like she was stuck in a never-ending cycle of trying to prove herself, but every time she thought she'd finally reached a milestone, someone else would come along and show her how little she knew. She began to wonder if she was cut out for this field after all. It was hard to keep going when everything seemed so unfair. She started to doubt whether she’d ever be able to reach the same level as everyone else, no matter how hard she worked.

Triggering Event: She slammed her fist onto the kitchen counter, sending a glass shattering to the floor. The email had arrived while she was out walking her dog, a stark reminder of why she'd left journalism: a young upstart, fresh out of college, had been hired in her place. They'd used her contacts, her sources, her story ideas, and given them to someone else. Someone without her decades of experience. She could feel the rage boiling inside her, like lava ready to erupt from a volcano.

Didn’t they understand how hard it was to get a job in this field? How many people had fought for every position? It wasn’t fair! This was personal; everyone knew her, everyone remembered her, and yet no one seemed to care about what happened to her now. All these people who once cheered her on were now silent, watching her fall. Even her friends, those who had stood by her through thick and thin, didn’t seem to be there for her anymore. They just kept telling her, “It’s business, honey,” as if I was somehow less than human because I got fired. Like I deserved it. I’m an old woman with gray hair, tired eyes, and a heart full of stories. But still, I deserve respect. And this...this is disrespect. No, this isn’t just about losing my job; it’s about being disrespected, humiliated, and made to feel like nothing matters anymore. --- # Personalization This cognitive distortion occurs when we take a situation personally, assuming that our actions or behavior are directly responsible for another's negative feelings towards us. It looked like they were just hanging out, but then I saw that the TV was off, and the kitchen was empty. The silence inside was unsettling, and I couldn't shake off the feeling that something was wrong."
